gurmukhi: BrhrMq B`jq rx sUrM ] Qrhr krq loh qn pUrM ]
transliteration: Bhar-harant Bhajjat Ran Sooran|| Thar-har Karat Loh Tan Pooran||
translation: There was consternation, the warriors ran and their bodies wearing armour trembled;

gurmukhi: qVBV bjYN qbl Aru qUrM ] Gu`mI pyK suBt rn hUrM ]590]
transliteration: Tad-bhar Bajain Tabal Ar(u) Tooran|| Ghoummipekh Soubhat Ran Hooran||590||
translation: The trumpets resounded violently in the war and seeing the mighty warriors the heavenly damsels advanced towards them again.590.

gurmukhi: GuMmI rx hUrM nB JV pUrM lK lK sUrM mn mohI ] Awrux qn bwxM Cb ApRmwxM Aixduq KwxM qn sohI ]
transliteration: Ghounmiran Hooran Nabh Jhad Pooran Lakh Lakh Sooran Man Mohee|| Aaroun Tan Baanan Chhab Apramaanan Anidout Khaanan Tan Sohee||
translation: Returning from heaven the damsels moved towards the warriors and enchanted their mind; their bodies were red like the arrows saturated with blood and their beauty was unparalleled;

gurmukhi: kwCnI surMgM Cib AMg AMgM ljq AnMgM lK rUpM ] swiek diRg hrxI kumq pRjrxI brbr brxI bup kUpM ]591]
transliteration: Kaadhhanisuranadg Chhab(i) An Anadg Lajat Ananadg Lakh Roopan|| Saaik Drig Harnikoumat Prajarnidarbar Barnibudh Koopan||591||
translation: Seeing the beauty of these heavenly damsels, who were wearing elegantly coloured raiments, the cupid was felling shy and these were the intellingent heavenly damsels, doe-eyed, destroyers of bad intellect and wedders of mighty warriors.591.

gurmukhi: kml bdn swiek miRg nYxI ] rUp rws suMdr ipk bYxI ]
transliteration: Kamal Badan Saaik Mrig Ainee|| Roop Raas Soundar Pik Bainee||
translation: Their faces were like lotus, eyes like deer and utterance like nightingale, these heavenly damsels were stores of elegance;

gurmukhi: miRgpq kt Cwjq gj gYxI ] nYn ktwC mnih hr lYxI ]592]
transliteration: Mrigpat Kat Chhaadat Gad Gadnee|| Nain Kataachh Manah(i) Har Lainee||592||
translation: With gait of elephants, with slim waists of lion and were captivators of mind with the side glances of their eyes.592.

gurmukhi: suMdr miRg nYxI sur ipk bYxI icq hr lYxI gj gYxM ] mwDur ibiD bdnI subu`iDn sdnI kumiqn kdnI Cib mYxM ]
transliteration: Soundar Mrig Nainisur Pik Bainichit Har Lainigad Gadnan|| Maadhur Bidh(i) Badanisoubuddhin Sadanikoumtin Kadanichhab(i) Mainan||
translation: They have splendid eyes, their utterance is sweet like nightingale and they captivate the mind like the gait of the elephant; they are all-pervading, have charming faces, with elegance of the god of love, they are the store-house of good intellect, the de

gurmukhi: AMgkw surMgI ntvr rMgI JwNJ auqMgI pg DwrM ] bysr gjrwrM phUc ApwrM kic GuMGrwrM AwhwrM ]593]
transliteration: Aanadaa Suraninatvar Ranijhaanjh Outanngipag Dhaaran|| Besar Gadraaran Pahooch Apaaran Kach(i) Ghounghraaran Aahaaran||593||
translation: Have godly limbs; they stand slantingly on one side, wear anklets in their feet, ivory-ornament in their nose and have black curly hair.593.

gurmukhi: icbk cwr suMdr Cib DwrM ] Taur Taur mukqn ky hwrM ]
transliteration: Chibak Chaar Soundar Chhab(i) Dhaaran|| Thaur Thaur Mouktan Ke Haaran||
translation: These heavenly damsels of elegant cheeks and unique beauty, have wreaths of gems on various parts of their bodies;
